cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north tonight, then turning north-northeast on Wednesday and accelerating northeast across north-central Florida and the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf coast near Steinhatchee/Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – no watches posted for Florida east-central coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A – no warnings posted for Florida east-central coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts along Florida west coast from Bonita Beach to Aucilla River, including Tampa Bay, then Georgia and Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) in squalls possible Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of east-central Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches; localized ponding or minor flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands Wednesday
